etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in Corpus Glossary. From the uninflected (originally adverb) stem of south + wind

definitions: A wind blowing from the south.

notes.text: In Europe the south wind is typically warm and pleasant.

definitions: Usually with capital initials. Any one of the four tiles representing this wind. Also: the player who draws such a tile at the outset of a game, or who succeeds to this designation at a later stage.
